summary: This is an internal email chain regarding media inquiries about a Fox News story featuring a forensic pathologist's opinion that Jeffrey Epstein's death was a homicide, not a suicide. The FBI New York Public Affairs Specialist notes that both their office and the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) are declining to comment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The subject of the Fox News story and the death investigation; his manner of death (homicide vs. suicide) is being discussed.

events.title: Fox News story on Epstein death
events.description: Fox News publishes a story/interview with a forensic pathologist who states Jeffrey Epstein's death was a homicide, not a suicide.

keyFacts: A Fox News story on October 30, 2019, featured a forensic pathologist claiming Jeffrey Epstein's death was a homicide.
The FBI New York Field Office's Public Affairs Specialist was fielding media calls about this story.
Both the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) were declining to comment on the story at that time.
The document is an internal email regarding the handling of public inquiries about Epstein's controversial death.
